> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19652?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [cdfce2b...61be381](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19652?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Refactored the `get_loc` tests for scalars and intervals, and added additional cases to test (overlapping, non-monotonic with dupes).  The scalar case is still fully passing.

Haven't split the errors out into separate tests yet; wanted to see if the refactoring makes things better first.  Seems like splitting the errors out would add some bloat, but can do it if that would be preferred.

it’s well documented and pretty clear once u get pass the initial magic

@jorisvandenbossche @TomAugspurger

Closing this PR for the time being.  Not all that happy with this setup, as it seems a bit over-engineered.  Might try something similar later one once some of the `IntervalIndex` methods and API have been solidified.
